class slam.frontend_manager.graph.base_edges.Edge(measurements: tuple[Measurement, ...], factor: Factor, noise_model: Base)[source]

Bases: ABC, Generic[GraphVertex]

Base abstract edge.

__init__(measurements: tuple[Measurement, ...], factor: Factor, noise_model: Base) → None[source]
Parameters:

  • measurements – measurements which formed the edge.

  • factor – GTSAM factor.

  • noise_model – GTSAM noise model of the factor.

property index: int

Unique index of the edge.

Corresponds to the index of the factor in the factor graph.

abstract property all_vertices: set[GraphVertex]

Vertices of the edge.

class slam.frontend_manager.graph.base_edges.MultiEdge(vertex_set_1: set[GraphVertex], vertex_set_2: set[GraphVertex], measurements: tuple[Measurement, ...], factor: Factor, noise_model: Base)[source]

Bases: Edge

Base class for all multi-edges in the Graph. Multi-edge connects two sets of vertices.

Parameters:

  • vertex_set_1 – first set of vertices.

  • vertex_set_2 – second set of vertices.

  • measurements – measurements which formed the edge.

  • factor – GTSAM factor.

  • noise_model – GTSAM noise model of the factor.

Parameters:

  • vertex_set_1 – first set of vertices.

  • vertex_set_2 – second set of vertices.

  • measurements – measurements which formed the edge.

  • factor – GTSAM factor.

  • noise_model – GTSAM noise model of the factor.

class slam.frontend_manager.graph.base_vertices.NotOptimizableVertex[source]

Bases: Vertex

Base abstract non-optimizable vertex: does not have a GTSAM index & value, and is not included in GTSAM factor graph directly.

abstract update(value: Any) → None[source]

Updates the vertex with the new value.

Parameters:

value (Any) – new value.

class slam.frontend_manager.graph.base_vertices.OptimizableVertex[source]

Bases: Vertex

Base abstract optimizable vertex of the Graph: has a GTSAM index & value, and is included in GTSAM factor graph.

abstract property gtsam_instance: Pose3 | Rot3 | ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]] | NavState | ConstantBias

GTSAM instance of the vertex.

abstract property gtsam_index: int

Unique index of GTSAM instance.

marginalize(vertices: Iterable[GraphVertex]) → None[source]

Marginalizes out vertices.

Not implemented.

_set_index() → int[source]

Sets unique index for the new edge base on the size of the factor graph. Gtsam factor graph sets index to the factor by exploiting the size of the factor graph. This guarantees the uniqueness of the index. However, the size of the factor graph is not equal to the number of factors in the graph, because the factor graph may contain empty slots (null ptr objects). When the factor is removed, the size of the factor graph does not change. To reduce the size of the factor graph, the resize() method should be called.

Returns:

unique index.

slam.frontend_manager.graph.index_generator module

class slam.frontend_manager.graph.index_generator.IndexStorage[source]

Bases: object

Storage of unique indices.

If the storage is empty, min_idx = float(+inf) and max_idx = float(-inf)

property num_indices: int

Number of indices in the storage.

property min_idx: int

Minimum index in the storage.

property max_idx: int

Maximum index in the storage.

property indices: set[int]

Indices in the storage.

Adds index to the storage.

Parameters:

index – index to add.

remove(index: int) → None[source]

Removes index from the storage.

Parameters:

index – index to remove.

Normalize indices to start from 0.

Updates min and max indices.

Parameters:

index – new index to update min and max indices.

slam.frontend_manager.graph.index_generator.generate_index(index_storage: IndexStorage) → int[source]
Generates new index for the given indices with the rule:

new index = max index + 1.

Parameters:

index_storage – storage of indices.

Returns:

new index.
